resource.chars:
hepatic organs. Is it possible that the Malpighian 
tubules had originally the function of a liver?++
This is improbable, but it is well known that an 
organ may lose its original function, and yet 
persist because it is of use for some other 
purpose: one of these predominates at one 
time, another at another, and the organ may 
undergo structural modification in con-
sequence.
The author has found no trace of an organ in the 
<u>Invertebrata <\u>, which answers physiologically to 
the liver of the <u>Vertebrata <\u>; although it may be 
remarked that Blundstone (<u>Proc. Roy. Soc.<\u>, vol. 
38, p.442) states that the connective-tissue-cells in
the <u>Mollusca<\u> have a glycogenic function; and it is 
probable that this function may be performed by special 
cells in other forms of the <u>Invertebrata <\u>.
